deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text: @title Set of (helper) functions for signature verification

params._messageHash: The hash of the packed message (messageHash) to be signed

getMessageHash(address,string,uint256).details: This is done after packing the parameters

params._timestamp: Timestamp at which the proof was generated
params._userHash: Unique user hash of the platform of the stamp (GH, PoH, etc.)

returns._0: bytes Returns the hash of the packed message (a.k.a. messageHash)

getPackedMessage(address,string,uint256).details: This is done before the keccak256 hash

params._timestamp: Timestamp at which the proof was generated
params._userHash: Unique user hash on the platform of the stamp (GH, PoH, etc.)

params._ethSignedMessageHash: The signed messageHash created from the parameters
params._signature: The signature of the proof signed by the signer

splitSignature(bytes).details: This is necessary for the ecrecover function

returns.r: Returns the first 32 bytes of the signature
returns.s: Returns the second 32 bytes of the signature
returns.v: Returns the last byte of the signature

verify(address,address,string,uint256,by.details: Generate the signed messageHash from the parameters to verify the signature against

params._signature: The signature of the proof signed by the signer
params._signer: The signer of the signature (the owner of the contract)
params._timestamp: Timestamp at which the proof was generated
params._userHash: Unique user hash of the platform of the stamp (GH, PoH, etc.)

returns._0: bool Returns the result of the verification, where true indicates success and false indicates failure

devdoc.title: Set of (helper) functions for signature verification

getEthSignedMessageHash(bytes32).notice: Signs the messageHash with a standard prefix

getPackedMessage(address,string,uint256).notice: Packs three parameters (address, string, uint) into one packed message

recoverSigner(bytes32,bytes).notice: Recover the signer from the signed messageHash and the signature

splitSignature(bytes).notice: Splits the signature into r, s, and v
